quest.name: Where the Money Takes You
journal: Nonowato finds himself in a bit of a financial pickle.

A troubled Nonowato informs you that he has forgotten to reimburse Rowena for some materials she procured at his request. Rowena has also personally asked for your help with a job of her own by way of an apology. Agreeing to help Nonowato in his hour of need, you brace yourself for a meeting with Rowena at her Center for Cultural Promotion.

Rowena receives quite a surprise when she realizes that the miner she has heard so much of is none other than the Warrior of Light. However, she soon brushes this initial distraction aside to get down to business: you are to mine twenty chunks of serpentine for her. Request received, you set off to make amends for Nonowato's error.

You deliver the serpentine to Rowena as requested and she furnishes you with Nonowato's order: a set of research materials. Before you leave for the Bangpots, she remarks that it has been quite some time since she last saw Stickqix. Apparently the manufactory chief stops by fairly often to check on his orders, but has not done so of late.

Nonowato is just about at his wit's end when you finally deliver the research materials to him. After making a not-so-subtle attempt at pretending all is well with the project, he confesses that Stickqix has gone missing. With your input, Nonowato concludes that the chief has likely gone to see Slowfix for advice on the project, and suggests that you seek out the goblin.

Slowfix regrettably has no information as to Stickqix's whereabouts, but he is able to tell you something else of note. The knowledgeable goblin fills you in on Stickqix's past, just why he decided to come to Idyllshire, and about the dream that led to the creation of his manufactory. Having heard this, Nonowato resolves to head back to the Bangpots and reinvigorate the workers there.

Nonowato explains to the Bangpots workers just why their esteemed chief has deserted them. He follows up by stressing the need for cooperation to the team, explaining that it is the only chance they have of completing work on the Gobroller without Stickqix's guidance. All come to realize the error of their ways, vowing to finish their work, whilst aiding their colleagues. Nonowato bids you join him outside to discuss the remainder of your own work.

Nonowato informs you that the next task he gives you will likely be your last. You prepare yourself for one final push, knowing that the Gobroller's completion draws near.

※The next miner quest will be available from Nonowato upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Mine serpentineDeliver the chunks of serpentine to Rowena.
Deliver the research materials to Nonowato.
Speak with Nonowato in Stickqix's Bangpots.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I'm late, I'm late!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Oh, I, um, hello there, Forename! Sorry, you've caught me at a bit of a bad time. Are you familiar with Rowena? Well, um, not quite sure how it happened but...I've forgotten to pay her for a job!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I've been so busy of late, it completely slipped my mind! Mercifully, she is not demanding any extra coin for the delay─instead, she has requested help with a job of her own. In fact, if I don't cooperate, she says she won't give me the goods I had her procure for me in the first place...

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: What's more, she wants you of all people to carry out this task! I haven't a clue who, but someone told her that a skilled miner had been seen frequenting Stickqix's Bangpots of late.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I hate to press this upon you, but please...I beg of you, help Rowena in my stead!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I feel truly awful for putting you in this position, but I have no one else to whom I can turn! Please help her procure the ore she desires.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Why in the bleeding hells didn't he say anything to us?

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Well, I think it is safe to say we are positively doomed!

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: Would it have been so hard for him to at least leave us a letter?

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox wants to find out what happened. Was it Stackblox's fault?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be. Never did I expect that the miner wanderin' around the Bangpots would turn out to be the one an' only Forename Surname.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Do you just like the feel of a pickaxe in your hand, or are you truly that desperate for coin? None of my business, I suppose.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Anyroad, as Nonowato may have told you, you're to bring me some serpentine. An' you can go ahead an' tell him that I expect this to be the last time he gives me any trouble!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Oh, and I suppose I ought to tell you that you won't find it anywhere save in Yanxia, in the Far East. Precisely why it fetches such a pretty price here in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Bring me twenty of 'em and you can tell Nonowato that we're square.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Whatever am I supposed to do?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I expect twenty chunks of serpentine. Twenty, you hear me?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good lasslad! Well, you've held up your end o' the bargain. Here's what Nonowato was after.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Thanks for that. A good bit of business. Still a bit puzzled as to what's goin' on at Stickqix's Bangpots, mind you. I've worked with them for some time now and never had any trouble gettin' compensated for my services before.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Now that I think on it, I haven't seen much of Stickqix lately. He tends to stop by every now an' then to check the quality of orders and the like, but I can't remember for the life of me the last time he came here.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Thanks for that, lasslad. An' do see that Nonowato gets his order. Knowin' him, he's probably been frettin' over it ever since he sent you.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Please, put me out of my misery. How did it go?

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Oh, thank heavens! With this, we can continue our work on the Gobroller. Well, I suppose since there are no other pressing issues at this point in time...

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: No. I cannot in good conscience lie to someone who has helped me so much. Allow me to apologize to you, Forename. It is high time I apprised you of the current state of our work.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: For a while now the project has been at a standstill. And, before you jump to any conclusions, this has nothing to do with quarrels breaking out between our workers. No, it is much more serious. Chief Stickqix is...missing.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I have tried and tried to ascertain his whereabouts, but no one has been able to help. I don't suppose you have heard anything?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Everyone's bickering had him at the end of his tether.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He said something about visiting Slowfix.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: He was worried by the recent infighting, you say? Oh, Chief...it is all my fault.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: If that's the case, he may have gone to ask someone for advice on how to improve things! What's more, that same someone could know where he is!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I can only think of one person─by which I mean goblin─that the chief would go to advice for: Slowfix! Come along, Forename, let us seek him out!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: He went to Slowfix for advice, you say? What on earth could he...ah, but of course. He must have sought him out to discuss all the recent bickering between the manufactory workers.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: It really matters not why he went to speak with him. What's important is finding out if Slowfix knows just where the chief is.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: As we have no other clues at this moment, I suggest we seek out Slowfix posthaste! Come along, Forename!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I do hope that Slowfix knows something of use. If not, I honestly have no idea where to search...

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Worried about the chief? That makes two of us, Forename. Just where in the world has he run off to?

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: So, you have heard about the chief. Even the most noble of revolutions are doomed to fail without a strong leader. I do hope ours returns soon.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: I have searched tirelessly for the chief, but to no avail. Detective work has never exactly been my forte, I must be honest.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... No Stickqix gives Stackblox the shiveryshakes!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Ah, Mr. Slowfix! I was wondering if you might have the time to answer a few questions of mine?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Slowfix has no need to trade tongueflaps to guess what knowings uplanders want. Uplanders would have Slowfix explain where Stickqix went, yes?

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: You know the chief's whereabouts!?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Slowfix has lots of knowings but not those ones. Stickqix had the shiveryshakes as his workers trade fists instead of tongueflaps!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Stickqix used to be one of the Illuminati. But as they became crazier and crazier, he chose to run away from the bad gobbies!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Coming to Idyllshire─home to both gobbies and uplanders─Stickqix was sure he had made the right decision. Told Slowfix that this was his dream!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Stickqix made Bangpots so uplanders and gobbies can sweatwork together for a bright future! Slowfix would have workers keep this in their braincases.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: ...I shall talk to everyone about this. You have my word.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I would greatly appreciate your presence when I do, Forename. Pray, come with me to the manufactory once more.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Eastwise? Westwise? Slowfix does not know where Stickqix went. But Slowfix thinks uplanders should keep his dream in their braincases.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: You have no idea how reassuring your presence is, Forename. Wait a moment while I gather the others.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Why does Nonowato summon Stackblox?

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I have asked you all to lend me your ears as I wish to share what we have found out about the chief's disappearance.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: In short, you are saying that the chief's desertion is down to us?

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: It is the end of the world as we know it. And yet, I cannot criticize the chief's actions. We have tested his patience time and time again.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: It's hard to believe, but our own bickering has destroyed the very dream we came together to make a reality. We're nothing without the chief's guiding hand.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Are you of the same mind, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The Gobroller can be finished without the chief.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Krystrymm is right, the Gobroller is done for.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Quite right! However, we first need to change our approach. Only then can we continue the project that Stickqix started.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I suppose you are correct. We can't hope to continue work on the Gobroller as things stand. It is up to us to change─only then will we be able to finish this project!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Quite right, it was silly of me to even ask. It goes without saying that the Gobroller must be completed! But first, we must change our approach to the project.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Nonowato's words excite Stackblox! The time has come to finish the Gobroller!

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Nonowato, the fire in your heart is infectious! But tell me, just what do you mean when you say we must change?

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: We need to focus on working together as a team, not as a collection of individuals!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: I myself know just how easy it is to get caught up in matters that only concern oneself. For the duration of this project, I have consistently relied on Forename's help and done nothing of note. But that ends today! As of this moment, we are a team in the truest sense of the word.

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: This, I am convinced, is the key to finishing the Gobroller as well as continuing our work long into the future! The chief would no doubt say the exact same were he here today.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox backthinks to Stickqix saying the same thing. The impossible is possible if we help each other.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: Yes, quite an idea! My eyes were once clouded, but now they are perfectly clear.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: It'll go some way towards making up for us disappointing the chief too!

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: This is it! At last, the revolution I have been waiting for!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: We know what we must do. Let us finish what we started, for the chief!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Forename, if you have the time, let us speak outside.

dialogue.name: KRYSTRYMM
dialogue.text: Young Nonowato's words have removed all confusion from my mind! I was so caught up in my own little world that I didn't stop even once to think of the meaning behind our work. It's time to get serious.

dialogue.name: ZANSEI
dialogue.text: Sorry for how long it has taken to sort ourselves out, Forename. But do not worry, it will all have been worth it when you are able to feast your eyes on our glorious Gobroller! Please continue to lend us your pickaxe until that time comes.

dialogue.name: FOHCWYDA
dialogue.text: It is all well and good just throwing yourself head first into your work, but we really could have done with being a bit more flexible. I should have listened to my own words when I complained about Krystrymm refusing to adapt to a different way of thinking. My apologies for involving you, Forename.

dialogue.name: STACKBLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Stackblox should have done more hand-lending for the others. Stackblox won't make the same mistake twice!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: Thank you for everything, Forename. The chief may still be missing, but my faith in our workers has never been stronger!

dialogue.name: NONOWATO
dialogue.text: There's one last job I would have you do when you feel ready. That should provide us with everything we need to finally finish this project!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In breaking new ground as a miner, you have learned “Bountiful Yield II”!
